page.title: 02LANDSCAPE AND BUILDINGS
page.content:
Landscape and Buildings
The largest village in our area is Withernwick, but that is still quite a small village. It has fields all around it. About 430 people live in the parish of Withernwick. If you come to Withernwick you will find a post office, a pub called the Falcon, a Methodist chapel and a butchers's shop all on Main Street. St. Alban's Church is at the corner of Church Lane and West Lambwath Road. (Lambwath is the name of a near by stream.) The school with 45 pupils you will find on Aldbrough Road on the outskirts of the village. There is W.I. Hall on Aldbrough Road too.
